thread.title: Enjoy Etihad luxury on a flight to Australia
thread.title_full: Enjoy Etihad luxury on a flight to Australia - Telegraph

author: The Telegraph
title: Enjoy Etihad luxury on a flight to Australia
text: With captivating cities, beautiful beaches, ancient rainforests, vast desert landscapes and fantastic food and drink, there are few places in the world that offer as much diversity as Australia . And there is no finer way to get there than by flying with Etihad Airways. With daily services from London, Manchester and Edinburgh to Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane and Perth via its hub in Abu Dhabi, your journey to Australia will be an experience in itself. All three of Etihad’s daily flights from London are operated by the airline’s flagship Airbus A380, the innovative double deck aircraft which also now connects through to Sydney. Brisbane also enjoys a flagship product as one of the first destinations to welcome Etihad’s new Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner, one of the most technologically advanced aircraft in its class. On board all Etihad’s aircraft and across all cabins, the service is outstanding – Etihad Airways is renowned for its in-flight hospitality and fine dining. During your flight, you’ll relish the taste of the freshest ingredients that go into making classic dishes. Guests enjoy an entertainment system with hundreds of hours of on-demand movies, box sets, music, games and live TV channels. When it comes to First Class, stepping in to Etihad’s new First Apartment on board the A380 is like entering a luxurious suite Etihad’s Business Class guests all benefit from a fully flat bed with direct aisle access, so that nobody is disturbed during the flight. Eligible guests in First and Business Class enjoy Etihad Chauffeur service and lounge access with à la carte dining, a business centre, family room and shower facilities. When it comes to First Class, stepping in to Etihad’s new First Apartment on board the A380 is like entering a luxurious suite. There’s a 6ft 9in bed in your personal room, a 24in flatscreen TV, chilled drinks cabinet, wardrobe, vanity unit and leather armchair in which to relax. First Class guests also have the luxury of a personal in-flight chef who will prepare your meal at any time of the flight. Passengers looking for a private jet experience between London and Sydney can fly in The Residence – the world’s only three-room suite in the sky. The Residence comes with a separate living space, bedroom and bathroom and even its own dedicated butler and in-flight chef. Arriving in Abu Dhabi for your onward flight to Australia, The Etihad Airways Premium Lounge awaits First and Business Class passengers. Here, the classic lounge offerings are combined with a Six Senses spa. Whichever way you choose to travel, with Etihad Airways you’ll arrive in style, relaxed and ready to enjoy your Australian adventure. Etihad Airways, voted the World’s Leading Airline at the World Travel Awards, offers flights from London, Manchester and Edinburgh via Abu Dhabi to Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane and Perth from £576 per person. Terms and conditions apply.
